Html:
After following a lot of different tutorials on building and configuring the sproxy addition to VS2008 I finally got everything up and running.

I now sit with the above SDL0000 error when trying to generate a header file to include in my project. I am not sure why this error was generated so I went through the source code and the error is linked to the sproxy.cpp file when evaluating the arguments. I have tried various different combinations of arguments to get my header file generated without any luck?

If anyone has encountered the same error or know of a possible solution please assist?

Hi.
I've just compiled sproxy in VS2012 ant it's working fine.
I tested with one server from http://www.webservicex.net/ws/default.aspx that shows the global weather forecast: http://www.webservicex.net/globalweather.asmx?WSDL

I managed to create the header file with the following command:
.\sproxy.exe /wsdl http://www.webservicex.net/globalweather.asmx?WSDL /out:weather.h
where "weather.h" is my output file.

What command are you using to try to create the header file?

Marcos

Hi Marcos,

Thanks for the reply, I have tried using the same command that you used above and still I get the same error. Even when trying to build the header file using the weather web service I still get the same error.

I am not sure if this is linked to my OS or possibly a missing reference somewhere? I am using Windows 7 64bit.

Will debug the sproxy source in VS and see if I can find more details...

Thanks again...
